body:
Hi, my name is Firebonezz!

In my time joining in Teamspeak, I had an idea!

We need Teamspeak`s moderators, they can ban, kick, move people, all the teamspeaks things.
They can help to keep a clean chat and see if everything is in order and stuff like that.

Avicus Idea:

We all know that most moderators of Avicus are english and some of they can`t understand the spanish people and their insults or reports(appeals,etc), we need some spanish moderators to keep avicus cleaner!

Thanks !
body_tagged:

Thanks !
title: [TeamSpeak Idea & Avicus Idea]

replies.body:
Boo! I'm a Moderator!

Ingame moderators are also able to kick, ban, mute and move people in Teamspeak.

Also, we do have some Spanish staff, though I cant exactly remember their names. :P

Thanks for the ideas, however.
replies.body_tagged:
Boo! I'm a Moderator!

Ingame moderators are also able to kick, ban, mute and move people in Teamspeak.

Also, we do have some Spanish staff, though I cant exactly remember their names. :P

Thanks for the ideas, however.

replies.body:
We need Teamspeak`s moderators, they can ban, kick, move people, all the teamspeaks things.
They can help to keep a clean chat and see if everything is in order and stuff like that.

Thats a Staff Members job. If you're a mod on the Avicus Network, you also have to frequently moderate the Teamspeak network so that is really already a thing :P

Spanish Moderators:
We have some Spanish moderators such as Javipepe and Vinnx or some staff that just take Spanish at school such as me or MasterProX but if you want someone who you can verbally approach, try finding Javipepe or Vinnx.



edit: elsa ninja q_q

replies.body: I appreciate the idea! However, we have a very large amount of moderators on Teamspeak. In fact assuming it's not a weekday we would have at least one mod on. Although I do agree I plan on improving the activity of some moderators.

replies.body: No estudio español más en mi escuela porque terminé mis clases obligatorias de español hace dos años. Ahora aprendo en mi propio tiempo. Mi salvador Kyler — el moderador "timaeusTestified" o "Vinnx" (él tiene aproximadamente otro millón de nombres) — me rescata cuando mis traslaciones son inexactas, o simplemente cuando necesito ayuda en general. Aun así, mi español es bastante rudimentario y probablemente no tan confiable como ese de un hablante nativo...
replies.body_tagged: No estudio español más en mi escuela porque terminé mis clases obligatorias de español hace dos años. Ahora aprendo en mi propio tiempo. replies.body:
We already have TeamSpeak Moderators, they're called Moderators.

Please make being on TeamSpeak regularly a requirement for all staff members, it will do nothing but good for the Teamspeak community.

replies.body:
I think you all get it wrong (?)
I assume his point is not the activity of the moderators, it's that he is spanish and there are certain situations that happen with spanish language and only 2 of our moderators speak spanish fluently and he's trying to say that we should have more spanish moderators. However i still do agree that mods need to be more active on ts but it's not the point of the thread I guess.

reply_to.body: No estudio español más en mi escuela porque terminé mis clases obligatorias de español hace dos años. Ahora aprendo en mi propio tiempo. Mi salvador Kyler — el moderador "timaeusTestified" o "Vinnx" (él tiene aproximadamente otro millón de nombres) — me rescata cuando mis traslaciones son inexactas, o simplemente cuando necesito ayuda en general. Aun así, mi español es bastante rudimentario y probablemente no tan confiable como ese de un hablante nativo...
